name: stably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is firm or firmly fixed, or not likely to move or change: Young people were advised to delay having children until at least one parent was stably employed.
chemistry
  specialized in a way that keeps the same chemical or atomic state: Na and K can be stably removed if other ions of the same charge are added in their place.
More examplesFewer examplesThe company says its wind farm would provide pollution-free, stably priced electricity for decades.I think the American-Chinese relationship will probably go on relatively stably.We had to make sure we ran the economy stably in case there was a downturn.The research includes married couples and "stably cohabiting couples".The physicochemical architecture of the antigen-binding groove dictates how stably a lipid ligand binds CD1d.
